952100.name: Bad Pixels
952100.description:
8-Bit first person shooter set in the old west! Have you ever wondered what a FPS game would look like in 8-bit? It's gotta look bad, right?

Bad Pixels is a gritty, hoodlum-shooting, gristle-chewing, law-avoiding retro style FPS. As Sheriff in this reckless retro environment, you must round up a team of deputies to help you flush out wrong doers, cash-in on wanted contracts and restore the peace.

Features:

  • Classic first person “boomer shooter” style action.

  • Wild West themed antics.

  • RTS style deputy management system.

  • 16 main missions with various boss fights.

  • 3 difficulty modes.

  • Variety of interesting weapon types.

  • Mission designer for custom missions.

  • 5 main environment types.

  • SID Chiptune sound track and effects.

  • Numerous references to Commodore 64, Amiga and retro computing.

  • Grit!

Gameplay:

Choosing from a range of jobless drifters, assemble a team of hired deputies to take on missions, ranging from disturbances in the peace, to resolving dead or alive wanted notices. Enemies will not stand idly by for you to capture or kill them however, so your finest first person shooting skills are required to chase down these wrong doers, while also commanding your own team to control the scene.

Deputies:

Using an in-game menu, you can command your deputies to perform certain tasks, like patrolling, sentry and following. If a member of your team meets a grizzly end, they are gone forever. Try your best to keep them alive, so they may also reap the rewards between missions.

Environments:

In an 8-bit style, explore dusty towns, remote hills, snowy outposts and spooky graveyards. Great care has been taken to recreate these locations as realistically as possible using only the finest lines and polygons the 8-bit world has to offer.

Weapons:

Without getting too futuristic, there are some steam powered items to find, along with the usual knives, pistols, shotguns, rifles and … explosives!

Leaderboards, Perma-Upgrades and Achievements:

How far can you go on one credit? There is no lives system in Bad Pixels, once all members of your team have perished, it is game over. But that is not the end, you might be rewarded with special skill badges that you can use on your next run.

Controls & Compatibility:

Along with the classic WASD + mouse controls, Bad Pixels is also playable on analog stick game pads. 

Keyboard:
WASD + mouse for move and look.
R = reload
E = interact
SHIFT = sprint
2 = weapon down
3 = weapon up
SPACE = crouch
LMB = shoot
RMB = jump
ESC = pause
TAB = console

Gamepad:
L STICK = move
L STICK BUTTON = sprint
R STICK = look
L TRIGGER = crouch
R TRIGGER = shoot
Y = reload
X = interact
B = jump
A = shoot
START = pause 

So pick up that controller, keyboard, or strange custom device, grease up your 6 iron, don your stetson and shake them snakes outta your boots, we’re going on a wild ride!
